page.description: Case insensitive. Returns .t. if a string is found in a list of comma delimited values. Differs from inlist() in that the list to search is a single argument, rather than multiple arguments.
page.syntax: Result as L = INLIST2(C lookfor ,C comma_delimited_list )

argument.name: lookfor
argument.description: The text you want to find.

argument.name: comma_delimited_list
argument.description: The text that you want to search.

page.discussion: Tests to see if a string is in a comma delimited list of values. Contrast this with the INLIST()function.

section.description: Note that the INLIST() function takes a variable number of arguments.
